Class: GroundSprites

plugins/layer/ground-sprites. GroundSprites

new GroundSprites(layerName, opts)

A layer that holds normally flat sprites that are intended to be drawn after the ground, but before the buildings and other sprites. Note that this should not be constructed directly, but rather via the plugin factory method sn.addLayer('ground-sprites') on the engine.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
layerName String A name for the layer. You might see it later on in error messages.
opts Object Parameters for customizing the layer. There are no parameters for this layer plugin though, so feel free not to pass any in.

Methods

purgeAll()

Remove all sprites from the layer.

spawnSprite(defName, stateName, stateExt, x, y, opts)

Spawn a new sprite on the ground plane
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
defName The name of the sprite definition to use. These are set up in your game's spriteDefs data.
stateName The initial state. This too is defined in the sprite's definition, in your game's spriteDefs data.
stateExt The initial state extension. This too is defined in the sprite's definition, in your game's spriteDefs data.
x Function/Number The world x coordinate. If a function, it should take no parameters and return a number.
y Function/Number The world y coordinate. If a function, it should take no parameters and return a number.
opts Object <optional>
 Optional parameter object. See sn.spawnSprite for sprite spawn option values.
